oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter of support from Gordon R. Clapp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Typewritten copy of letter from Gordon R. Clapp. Clapp expresses his concern that Highlander is being investigated for "'subversive' activities" even though he knows nothing of the sort occurs at the school. He applauds the work of the school and encloses a donation.
Gordon R. Clapp served as chairman of the Tennessee Valley Authority from 1946 to 1954.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clapp, Gordon R. (Gordon Rufus), 1905-1963
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 114: 81st General Assembly Special Investigating Committee Highlander Folk School, 1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Governmental investigations; Subversive activities; Education; Communism; Educators
